title: [Large-Scale] OER-Based Open Educational Practice Design and Utilization of Social Collaboration

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital literacy, secondary education experience, and understanding of socially collaborative learning
context.additional_context: A course for in-service secondary teachers to enhance their competency in designing lessons utilizing Open Educational Resources (OER). Through collaborative learning and knowledge sharing among practitioners, it explores solutions to regional educational disparities and contributes to realizing civic engagement and educational equality.

learning_goals: Explain the concept of OER and legal/ethical principles for its use within a social context.
Collaborate with peer teachers using collaborative tools (e.g., Padlet) to co-develop OER-based lesson materials and establish educational relationships.
Design a process for searching, analyzing, and applying OER suitable to oneâ€™s subject area and explore solutions to address regional educational disparities.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
